item.title: Explosion at mosque in Syria's Homs kills three, says local official
item.description: Three people were killed and five injured when an explosion struck a mosque in an Alawite neighbourhood in the Syrian province of Homs on Friday, a local official said. Syrian state media said security forces had imposed a cordon around the area and were investigating. Local officials told Reuter

item.title: Only a credible election can heal Bangladesh’s deep wounds: Press Secretary
item.description: Chief Adviser’s Press Secretary Shafiqul Alam on Friday said Bangladesh bears deep wounds—an ever-widening fracture that only a truly credible election can heal. In a post from his verified Facebook account, he said the general election and the referendum are now just seven weeks away&

item.title: White House to present plans for Trump's East Wing ballroom in January
item.description: The White House will unveil new details on President Donald Trump's planned East Wing ballroom during a hearing early next month, according to a federal commission tasked with reviewing the project. The new ballroom, which Trump has said would cost $400 million and would dwarf the adjacent White H

item.title: Two missing as freight vessel hit by launch capsizes in Narayanganj
item.description: A sand-laden freight vessel has capsized in the Buriganga River in Narayanganj’s Fatullah after it was hit by a launch carrying passengers. At least two workers went missing in the incident that occurred in the Dharmaganj area around 6:15 am on Friday, according to Pagla River Police Outpost

item.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib convicted in 1MDB corruption case
item.description: Malaysia’s High Court on Friday convicted former Prime Minister Najib Razak in a major corruption case linked to the multibillion-dollar 1MDB state fund scandal. The court found Najib, 72, guilty of four counts of abuse of power and 21 counts of money laundering involving more than $700 mill

item.title: Mild cold wave hits Chuadanga, disrupts normal life
item.description: A mild cold wave is sweeping across the southwestern district of Chuadanga, disrupting normal life. According to the local met office, the district recorded this season’s lowest 9.6 degrees Celsius of temperature at 9am on Friday. Vehicles were seen moving with headlights to prevent any unwa

item.title: Tarique pays tribute at Ziaur Rahman’s grave
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman on Friday paid homage to late President Ziaur Rahman by visiting his mausoleum at Zia Udyan in Sher-e-Bangla Nagar, Dhaka. He entered the mausoleum premises at around 4:40 pm. Party leaders and activists gathered in Chandrima Udyan and nearby areas lined the road

item.title: 148 tonnes of waste cleared from Tarique rally venue
item.description: Dhaka North City Corporation has cleared 148 tonnes of waste from Purbachal’s July 36 Expressway, commonly known as the 300 Feet Road, where BNP’s Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman attended a reception upon returning home after 17 years in exile. In a statement on Friday, the DNCC said it

item.title: Meta takes down Asif Mahmud’s official Facebook page
item.description: Meta has removed the verified Facebook page of Asif Mahmud Shojib Bhuyain, who recently stepped down from his role as an advisor to the interim government to contest the upcoming general election. In a post on his personal Facebook account on Friday, Asif said that his official page, which had mor

item.title: Thai defence minister to attend truce talks with Cambodia, PM says
item.description: Thailand's defence minister will join ongoing talks with Cambodia on Saturday that could lead to a truce, the Thai premier said on Friday, as border clashes between the two Southeast Asian neighbours continued for a third week. If the defence minister is able to come to an agreement with his Cambo

item.title: Fire at Gulistan market
item.description: A fire has broken out on the roof of the eight-storey Gulistan Khaddar Bazar Super Complex in Dhaka. The incident was reported at 5:28pm on Friday, according to Fire Service duty officer Ruzina Akter. “Six units have been deployed to control the blaze,” she added. The cause of the fi

item.title: Sakhawat announces compensation for launch accident victim
item.description: Shipping Adviser Brigadier General (retd) Dr M Sakhawat Hossain today said the government will provide Tk 150,000 each to the families of the persons died in a lunch accident at Chandpur on Friday. Families of the each injured persons will get Taka 50,000, he said while talking to reporters after
